TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed EncryptionAlgorithm extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the encryption algorithm used to encrypt the message body of a private message.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Cipher modes define the method in which data is encrypted. The stream cipher mode encodes data one bit at a time. The block cipher mode encodes data one block at a time. Although it tends to execute more slowly than stream cipher, block cipher is more secure. The following table describes the cipher mode for each of the <xref:System.Messaging.EncryptionAlgorithm> values.
|Encryption|Cipher mode| |----------------|-----------------| |RC2|64-bit block| |RC4|Stream|
The Message Queuing message object's property ultimately provides access to operating system encryption levels.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Messaging.EncryptionAlgorithm None = int32(0)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Messaging.EncryptionAlgorithm Rc2 = int32(26114)

Docs.summary: The value MQMSG_CALG_RC2. This is the default value for the encryption property of the Message Queuing application's message object.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Messaging.EncryptionAlgorithm Rc4 = int32(26625)

Docs.summary: The value MQMSG_CALG_RC4. This corresponds to the less secure option for the encryption property of the Message Queuing application's message object.
